intro: Viola primulifolia var. ovata, commonly known as the broadleaf violet, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of purple and blue. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and shaded gardens. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
